com.percussion.server.cache
Class PSCacheProxy

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.server.cache.PSCacheProxy

public class PSCacheProxy
extends Object

This class provides access to various operations against the Rhythmyx server's cache subsystem. Currently there are two types of caching: Assembler and Resource. Assembler caching handles pages that are returned from queries to DataSets that are specified by Content Variant registrations. Resource caching handles pages cached based on settings within the DataSet. Methods are provided to flush particular sets of pages cached by either type, all pages cached by either type, all pages returned by an application, all pages cached for a particular session, or the entire cache, regardless of page type.

Constructor Detail

public PSCacheProxy()
Method Detail

flushApplication

public static void flushApplication(String appName)
                             throws PSCacheException
Flushes all cached pages returned by the specified application, without considering the cache type. If the application does not exist, or no pages are cached for this app, this method has no effect.

Parameters:
appName - The name of the application for which pages are to be flushed, may not be null or empty.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if appName is null or empty.
PSCacheException - if there are any other errors.

flushSession

public static void flushSession(String sessionId)
                         throws PSCacheException
Flushes all pages cached for the specified session, without considering the cache type. Pages with content that is specific to a particular user's session will be cached for that session, while others are cached without regard to session. If the specified session does not exist, or if no pages are cached for this session, this method has no effect.

Parameters:
sessionId - The id of the session for which cached pages should be flushed. May not be null or empty.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if sessionId is null or empty.
PSCacheException - if there are any other errors.

flushAssemblers

public static void flushAssemblers(String appName,
                                   Integer contentId,
                                   Integer revision,
                                   Integer variantId)
                            throws PSCacheException
Flushes all cached Assembler type pages that meet the specified criteria. If null is supplied for any parameter, it is not considered to be part of the search criteria. However, if revision is not null, then contentId must be supplied. For example, to flush all assembly pages cached that were requested using sys_variant=301: 

    PSCacheProxy.flushAssemblers(null, null, null, 301);
Pass null for all arguments to flush all Assembler pages. If there are no matching pages in the cache, this method has no effect.

Parameters:
appName - The name of the application for which the pages are cached, may be null, never empty.
contentId - The content id of the item for which the pages are cached, may be null.
revision - The revision of the item for which the pages are cached, may be null. Must be null if contentId is null.
variantId - The variant id for which the pages are cached, may be null.
Throws:
PSCacheException - if revision is supplied but contentId is null, if any other parameter is invalid, or if there are any other errors.

flushResources

public static void flushResources(String appName,
                                  String dataSetName)
                           throws PSCacheException
Flushes all cached Resource type pages that meet the specified criteria. If null is supplied for any parameter, it is not considered to be part of the search criteria. For example, to flush all pages cached by a DataSet named "foo", even if requested from different applications: 

    PSCacheProxy.flushResources(null, "foo");
Pass null for all arguments to flush all Resource pages. If there are no matching pages in the cache, this method has no effect.

Parameters:
appName - The name of the application for which the pages are cached, may be null, never empty.
dataSetName - The name of the DataSet for which pages are cached, may be null, never empty.
Throws:
PSCacheException - if any param is invalid or if there are any other errors.

flushAll

public static void flushAll()
                     throws PSCacheException
Flushes all caches, which includes Assemlber, Resource and Folder Cache.

Throws:
PSCacheException - if there are any error.

flushFolderCache

public static void flushFolderCache()
                             throws PSCacheException
Flushes and reloads the Folder Cache.

Throws:
PSCacheException - if there are any error.

flushHibernateCache

public static void flushHibernateCache()
Flush hibernate's second level cache
